p: Hanta virus causes hemorrhagic fever. It is also called as hanta virus cardio pulmonary syndrome, renal syndrome, and non-pathogenic prospects hill virus. It affects the function of kidney. The virus enters the host by interacting with cell surface integrin receptors and also uses alpha 5 beta 1 receptors to enter into the cell. The infection occurs by direct contact with infected rodents and inhaling virus through lungs. Hanta virus can be differentiated into many types such as Seoul virus from domestic rat, others are black creek canal virus, bayou virus etc. Symptoms include chillness, dizziness, headache, nausea, cough, vomiting, malaise, diarrhea, back pain, abdominal pain, and tachycardia. Diagnosis is based on positive serological test, blood samples detecting viral antigen, viral RNA sequences, serological assays, immunohistochemistry, and PCR. There is no antiviral drug for hanta virus but antipyretics and analgesic are used to control the disease ( Mir, 2010).
